title: Exploring COVID-19 Quarantine Breach
text: vignette demonstrates use covid19 package explore COVID-19 quarantine breach scenarios. covers:

what: 1. Creating a line plot for a specific R0.
title: Exploring COVID-19 Quarantine Breach
text: line plot shows relative force infection changes VE R0 = 3.
code: covid19 |> dplyr::filter(R0 == 3) |> ggplot(aes(x = VE, y = Value)) + geom_line(color = "blue", size = 1.2) + geom_point(color = "darkblue") + labs( title = "VE vs Relative Force of Infection for R0 = 3", x = "Vaccine Efficacy", y = "Relative Force of Infection" ) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> â„¹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning #> was generated.

title: Exploring COVID-19 Quarantine Breach
text: Shiny app provides user-friendly interface explore dataset interactively.

what: 3. Heatmap of relative force of infection
title: Exploring COVID-19 Quarantine Breach
text: heatmap shows relative force infection changes across combinations R0 VE. Higher values (yellow/white) indicate higher risk quarantine breaches leading transmission.
code: library(ggplot2)  # Ensure numeric covid19$R0 <- as.numeric(covid19$R0) covid19$VE <- as.numeric(covid19$VE)  # Heatmap without contour p <- ggplot(covid19, aes(x = R0, y = VE, fill = Value)) +   geom_tile(color = "black", width = 1, height = 0.1) +   geom_text(aes(label = sprintf("%.3g", Value)), color = "white", size = 3) +   scale_fill_gradientn(     colours = c("black", "darkred", "red", "orange", "yellow", "white"),     name = "Relative\nForce of Infection"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +   theme(     panel.grid = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_text(face = "bold"),     legend.title = element_text(face = "bold")   ) +   labs(     x = "R0 (Basic Reproductive Ratio)",     y = "VE (Vaccine Efficacy)",     subtitle = "Heatmap of Relative Force of Infection for all R0 values"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 0.9, 0.1), labels = sprintf("%.1f", seq(0, 0.9, 0.1))) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:10) +   # Add highlight boxes   annotate("rect", xmin = 2 - 0.5, xmax = 4 + 0.5, ymin = 0.9 - 0.05, ymax = 0.9 + 0.05,            color = "limegreen", fill = NA, linetype = "dotted", linewidth = 1.2) +   annotate("rect", xmin = 5 - 0.5, xmax = 8 + 0.5, ymin = 0.6 - 0.15, ymax = 0.8 + 0.05,            color = "yellow", fill = NA, linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 1.2) +   annotate("rect", xmin = 2 - 0.5, xmax = 4 + 0.5, ymin = 0.0 - 0.05, ymax = 0.0 + 0.05,            color = "cyan", fill = NA, linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 1.2)  print(p)

what: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Analysis and Visualisation
title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Analysis and Visualisation
text: covid19 package provides simulation data, visualization tools, interactive Shiny app explore COVID-19 quarantine breach scenarios. helps users understand different vaccine efficacy levels (VE) basic reproductive ratios (R0) influence relative force infection, allowing exploration potential outbreak risks various scenarios. package app inspired Zachreson et al.Â (2022).

title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Analysis and Visualisation
text: can install development version covid19 GitHub :

title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Analysis and Visualisation
COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Analysis and Visualisation
text: covid19 dataset contains simulated relative force infection values combinations R0 (basic reproductive ratio) VE (vaccine efficacy). R0: Basic reproductive ratio (1â€“10) VE: Vaccine efficacy (0â€“0.9) Value: Relative force infection

what: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
text: Simulated outcomes quarantine breach events different scenarios basic reproductive ratio (R0) vaccine efficacy (VE). Used explore relative force infection changes R0 VE.

title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
text: data frame 100 rows 3 columns: R0 integer, basic reproductive ratio: average number secondary infections produced infected person completely susceptible population. VE numeric, vaccine efficacy, representing reduction susceptibility infection. Value numeric, relative force infection produced quarantine breaches.

title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
